definition: to part with sth cherished/to forsake
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
to resign oneself to part with what one treasures

sentences.english: Your love is too easy to sell, the next instant to deletion.
sentences.chinese: 你的感情太易割爱，把未来转眼就删改。

sentences.english: Did you know that I am also your fan, but I am willing to reluctantly part with.
sentences.chinese: 您清楚我也是您的影迷，不过我愿意忍痛割爱。

sentences.english: When this happens, it’s best to bite the bullet and drop or delay a project or two.
sentences.chinese: 当这发生时，最好忍痛割爱，放弃或推迟一两个计划。

sentences.english: Would you live with ease, do what you ought, and not what you please.
sentences.chinese: 要想活得轻松自在，时时都要忍痛割爱。

sentences.english: If you would live with ease, do what you ought, and not what you please.
sentences.chinese: 要想活得轻松自在，时时都要忍痛割爱。

sentences.english: Are you willing to part with that toaster?
sentences.chinese: 那台烤土司机你愿意割爱吗？

sentences.english: He beguiled me into parting with the gem.
sentences.chinese: 他诱骗我把那枚宝石割爱。

definition: to resign oneself to part with what one treasures
to do sb the honor (of attending etc)/to put in an appearance/to show up
to give away/to accompany/to see sb off
(honorific) your respected opinion/What do you think, your majesty?
Don't get a reward if it's not deserved. (idiom)
(honorific) to present/to give as a present
lit. presenting the Buddha with borrowed flowers (idiom); fig. to win favor or influence using sb else's property/plagiarism
